Product Name: HP 15, Intel Core Ultra 5 125H (16GB DDR5, 1TB SSD) FHD, IPS, 15.6''/39.6cm, Win11, M365 Basic(1yr)*Office24, Silver, 1.65kg, fd1354TU, Intel Arc Graphics, FHD Camera w/Shutter, AI Powered Laptop
Reviews:
Bought an HP 15 (Intel Core Ultra 5 125H) laptop and noticed the power light stayed on with a faint fan sound even after shutdown. Thought it was a defect, but it’s actually because of Windows Fast Startup.To fix it, go to:Control Panel → Power Options → Choose what the power buttons do → Change settings → Uncheck “Turn on fast startup” → Save.After this, the laptop shuts down completely and the light turns off normally.Fast Startup just makes boot a bit faster, so disabling it is totally safe.Great laptop overall — smooth performance once this setting was adjusted! 👍

Read more | Good Laptop — but Warranty Issue Created by Amazon(Clicktech retail) , Not HP (Read if You're Facing the Same Problem)I purchased this HP laptop on 28th September 2025, mainly because it had everything I needed specially a backlit keyboard as mentioned in the catalogue — and yes, it indeed has one.💻 Product ReviewModel Number - 15-fd0572TU (backlit fs)The laptop looks really good and feels premium, especially considering it’s a budget-friendly HP. Build quality is neat, the design is sleek, and since it’s HP, reliability is something you can count on.Performance-wise, it’s smooth for everyday use — browsing, office work, entertainment — all run without any hiccups.If you’re getting this laptop for around ₹33K–₹34K, it’s a solid deal.Cons:Display: Could’ve been a little better, but still acceptable for normal use.Keyboard: Just okay - not bad, not great.Main Issue – Warranty Confusion: This part was not HP’s fault but Amazon’s.⚠️ Warranty Issue (and How I Solved It)When I checked the HP Support site, my warranty was showing as starting from 25th March 2025, which was six months before I actually bought the laptop. Apparently, that’s the date the seller imported it from China - and this happens often with HP laptops sold by third-party sellers.So effectively, I was left with only about 8 months of warranty instead of 1 year.I contacted HP support, and they asked for the purchase invoice to update the warranty.Here’s where Amazon messed up, the invoice they provided didn’t have the serial number or product ID printed on it. Without that, HP can’t verify your purchase date or extend the warranty.After this, I spent weeks calling both HP and Amazon - endless waiting, repeated explanations, lots of assurances but no actual solution.Finally, after persistence, I managed to get it fixed :- here’s how 👇✅ What You Should Do If You’re Facing the Same Problem1. Always ask to speak to a senior or escalation team — both on HP and Amazon sides. Regular customer service agents usually can’t resolve this.2. Don’t waste time repeatedly explaining your issue to first-level representatives — escalate right away.3. Ask Amazon to reissue your invoice with the serial number (though in my case, they refused).4. Request Amazon’s senior escalation desk to send you an official email (from an Amazon domain) confirming your name, serial number, order details, and purchase date.5. Share that official email with HP support, and request them to manually update your warranty period.6. Keep following up patiently — it takes effort, but HP can fix it if you provide all the required proof.💬 Final ThoughtsOverall, I have no complaints about the laptop itself — it’s a good, reliable machine with solid features for the price range.But the warranty issue is something you should be aware of before buying. The fault lies with Amazon for not printing the serial number on the invoice, which creates unnecessary frustration for customers.Once you get past that, it’s a great purchase.In short:✔️ Great budget HP laptop with backlit keyboard⚠️ Check warranty immediately after purchase🚫 Amazon should fix their invoicing system

The 15.6-inch Full HD anti-glare display is comfortable for long study hours, reducing eye strain. Battery life easily lasts through a full day of classes and homework.The laptop is lightweight and sleek, making it easy for my child to carry around. Overall, it’s an excellent choice for students who need a dependable and fast laptop for schoolwork and beyond. Highly recommended for educational purposes!

Product Name: JioBook 11 with Lifetime Office | Android 4G Laptop Mediatek 8788 (JioOS) | Octa-core | 4GB RAM | 64 eMMC Storage | Thin and Light Laptop (11.6 inch, 990 Grams) | Dual Band WiFi + SIM | Blue
Reviews:
Unusable, pathetic, don't waste your money on this or  other Jio products.Basic user interface such as double-clicking an icon to open the folder or app does not work properly -- when double-clicked, the icon simply disappears! Plus, you have to use an external keyboard and mouse, because if you use the in-built mouse and keyboard, the cursor jumps all over the place so much that you cannot even type in one sentence properly without the cursor jumping off to other places!Basic apps such as text editor, Word-equivalent, etc do not work properly. If you create a document in Office TextMaker which is pre-installed, and then save the doc, later TextMaker does not open that doc, it complains that the file format it saved the doc in is not supported! And, if you open a doc or docx file, modify it and then try to save it, instead of simply saving the file in the same format it asks you to select a format from a dozen options! Atrocious.Google Meet does not work properly. Many Android apps are not available or supported on this JioBook.This device tries to be both Android and a Linux laptop, ends up being neither. If you get fed up with its atrocious interface, there is no way to dual-install Linux or get basic Linux facilities such as a command terminal.The battery died in less than a year -- fortunately it was in the warranty period.Finally, email to their advertised customer care address bounces back! This company has abandoned this product and its users, and after doing that it does not even provide a way for users to skip their JioOS and install Linux, after JioOS is such a disaster. Never trust any hardware product from this company or their customer support!

Read more | I recently purchased the Dell G15 5520 Gaming Laptop, and I must say, it is an absolute powerhouse. Equipped with an Intel i5-12500H processor, 16GB DDR5 RAM, and a 512GB SSD, this laptop delivers an ultimate gaming experience. The NVIDIA RTX 3050 (4GB GDDR6) graphics card ensures smooth and immersive gameplay, making every session a visual treat.The 15.6" FHD WVA AG 120Hz display with 250 nits of brightness provides superb screen quality, perfect for both gaming and multimedia consumption. The vibrant colors and sharp details enhance the overall visual experience. The backlit keyboard with an orange hue adds a stylish touch, making it a pleasure to use even in low-light conditions.Despite its many strengths, the laptop does have one notable drawback—the battery life. Given its substantial weight and heavy-duty battery, I expected it to last at least three hours on a single charge. However, I was disappointed to find that the battery life only allows for about half an hour of gaming. This short battery life can be a significant inconvenience, especially for gamers who enjoy long sessions without being tethered to a power outlet.Aside from the battery issue, my experience with the Dell G15 5520 has been excellent. The laptop's performance, screen quality, and overall build make it a fantastic choice for gamers and power users alike. The combination of Windows 11 and Microsoft Office 2021 adds to its appeal, providing a seamless and efficient user experience.In summary:Performance: Top-notch gaming performance with Intel i5-12500H, 16GB DDR5 RAM, and NVIDIA RTX 3050.Display: Superb screen quality with a 15.6" FHD WVA AG 120Hz display.Design: Stylish backlit keyboard and robust build quality.Battery Life: Short battery life, only around 30 minutes of gaming on a single charge.Overall Experience: Despite the battery issue, an excellent gaming laptop.Overall, the Dell G15 5520 Gaming Laptop offers a great experience, provided you're prepared to deal with its limited battery life. If you're primarily using it in a stationary setup, this laptop will undoubtedly serve you well.
